alert.note: Alert for Baltimore (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 27 at 3:57PM EDT until June 27 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern Maryland, including the following counties: Baltimore, Baltimore City and Harford. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 356 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen, with locally up to 3 inches. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. If heavy rain continues, some areas may need a Flash Flood Warning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Baltimore... Cockeysville... Towson... Bel Air South... Catonsville... Parkville... Bel Air North... Carney... Perry Hall... Arbutus... Rosedale... Rossville... Brooklyn Park... Timonium... White Marsh... Fallston... Hampton... Kingsville... Pleasant Hills... Jarrettsville... - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
